message.content: This question requires some knowledge about the behavior of wild wolves and their interactions with humans. Wolves typically try to avoid contact with humans and are generally wary of human presence. Option (A) is incorrect because wolves are not human. Option (C) is incorrect because wolves primarily eat meat, not corn. Option (D) is incorrect because domesticated wolves are commonly known as dogs, not wild wolves.

This question requires knowledge about the behavior of wild wolves and their interactions with humans. Option (B) is correct because it states that wild wolves elude humanity. In general, wild wolves tend to avoid human contact and are more afraid of humans than humans are of them. Option (A) is incorrect because wolves are not human. Option (C) is untrue because wolves are carnivores and do not eat corn. Option (D) is also incorrect because wild wolves are not domesticated animals.
